snippet: The tightening of controls at the border led to a fall of about 44 percent decrease over the previous year in the number of North Koreans defecting to South Korea in 2012.
abstract: Human rights activists and South Korean officials say tightening controls at North Korea's border led to a fall of about 44 percent decrease over the previous year in the number of North Koreans defecting to South Korea in 2012.
lead_paragraph: The tightening of controls at the border led to a fall of about 44 percent decrease over the previous year in the number of North Koreans defecting to South Korea in 2012.

headline.seo: Crackdowns Make Fleeing North Korea Harder
headline.main: Fleeing North Korea Is Becoming Harder
headline.print_headline: Fleeing North Korea Is Becoming Harder
